H0.text: Genetic variation arises due to crossing over, independent assortment, and the random union of gametes.

H1.text: Susceptible variation arises due to crossing over, independent assortment, and the random union of gametes.

H2.text: Recessive variation arises due to crossing over, independent assortment, and the random union of gametes.

H3.text: Alternative variation arises due to crossing over, independent assortment, and the random union of gametes.

A4.text: Crossing over (genetic recombination) and random segregation during meiosis can result in the production of new alleles or new combinations of alleles.

A5.text: Random fertilization also contributes to variation.
